title: Claimed Huawei Nexus 6 gets early debut in render video | Trusted Reviews
description:
![Huawei Nexus
6](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-reviews-
placeholder-3.svg)

**Last year’s Nexus 6 met lukewarm reception, but can this year’s Google
phablet redeem the smartphone series?**

While we can’t say for sure, a new render video that purports to be the
Huawei-built Nexus 6 gives us some indication about what to expect.

The video comes courtesy of prolific – and generally reliable – rumour spinner
OnLeaks.

“The renders are based on detailed blueprints of the device sent out to third-
party accessory manufacturers ahead of the phone’s release,” writes comparison
site
[uSwitch](http://www.uswitch.com/mobiles/news/2015/08/uswitch_exclusive_huawei_nexus_6_photo_and_video_renders_confirm_same_rear_fingerprint_scanner_as_lg_nexus_5/),
an official partner of OnLeaks.

It continues: “According to our sources, Huawei tested two models, one with a
5.5in display and another 5.7in screen, either of which might be the one that
makes it to market.”

Check out the video below:

(YouTube)pBZgsRpFfP4(/YouTube)

  * 

So what does the video actually reveal?

For a start, the device features a fingerprint scanner on its rear.

What looks like a [USB-C](https://www.trustedreviews.com/opinions/usb-type-c-
everything-you-need-to-know) port sits on the bottom of the device. Offering
faster transfer rates and a reversible cable tip, we’ve already seen USB-C on
a number of devices, including Apple’s new 12in MacBook.

**SEE ALSO:[Best Android Smartphones
2015](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best-android-phones-1_round-up)**

Of course, both Google and Huawei have yet to reveal anything about the new
phone, so take this report with a pinch of salt.

It’s also worth mentioning that Google is also tipped to be working with South
Korean tech giant LG on a new Nexus 5 device for 2015.

Both handsets are expected to launch in October or November this year, but we
don’t have a release date confirmed at this point.

Also note that the phones will mark the debut of [Android
M](https://www.trustedreviews.com/opinions/android-m-features), Google’s next
mobile operating system.

What do you want to see from Google’s next Nexus handset? Let us know in the
comments.
